results.title: Four centuries of growing pains
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, Ronald Dick and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Commonwealth of Nations”.
The film traces the origins of the British Commonwealth through four hundred years of history. It reviews how countries like Canada, Australia, India, and other continental and island territories, came to be added, and how each developed to the point of self-government.

results.title: Four centuries ago
results.brief_description: Mogul architecture reflects Hindu, Sarasenic, and Arabic influences. Fatehbur Sikri, a deserted city near Agra, was built by Akbar the Mogul Emperor in 1569. His architectural achievements reflect his philosophy, combining Hindu design and Sarasenic carving in the mosque, pillar and gateway to this city which was later abandoned.
results.description: Mogul architecture reflects Hindu, Sarasenic, and Arabic influences. Fatehbur Sikri, a deserted city near Agra, was built by Akbar the Mogul Emperor in 1569. results.title: Four back rooms
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Films, Kenneth J. Fairbairn and Peter M Sims
results.brief_description: An indication of the research being carried out by the British Transport Commission in matters affecting transport and communications. Four examples of the work are given: design of railway lines; effect of counter currents on sea waves; siltage in rivers; stresses and strains in bus construction.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Films, Kenneth J. Fairbairn and Peter M Sims

results.title: Founded on science
results.creator_credit: James Carr, World Wide Pictures, British Information Services and James Allen
results.brief_description: Illustrates the role scientific research and development plays in civil engineering. Discusses varying methods of stabilising foundations, including repairing of existing foundations. Also details quality control testing of materials and/or methods.

results.title: Foundations of mathematics
results.creator_credit: Steve Campus Productions and Steve Campus
results.brief_description: Designed to show teachers working in the area of infant mathematics possible ways of using concrete equipment with an emphasis on formal pre-number work. Covers classifying and grouping; pattern; counting; equivalence; estimation; measurement; and shape. Suitable for lower primary and tertiary/teacher levels.

results.title: Found on a farm
results.brief_description: Depicts the adventures of four children during their visit to a farm. Their activities include fishing, looking at farm animals, and having a picnic in a shelter of straw bales. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Found
results.brief_description: This film effectively communicates a story as well as the emotions behind it with little reliance on dialogue. Annabelle explains the film ‘ A girl longs for connection with her absent father. A chance encounter brings new hope’ This film won the ACMI award for original sound in diegesis 2002.

group_siblings.title: A Life before
group_siblings.creator_credit: Jamie MacDowell, Jim Curtis and Nick Ball

results.title: Foto: Sven Nykvist
results.creator_credit: Philip Strick, Visual Programme Systems and Bayley Silleck
results.brief_description: This film explores the life and work of cinematographer, Sven Nykvist. Emphasises his style of lighting and sense of humanity through interviews and film clips from key Bergman and Nykvist productions. Features Liv Ullman and Erland Josephson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Strick, Visual Programme Systems and Bayley Silleck

results.title: Foster & Allen's Christmas collection
results.creator_credit: CMR Records, Quality Records and Bob Shipley
results.brief_description: Foster & Allen take us on a musical tour of Christmas with a selection of songs and carols. Interspersed with famous carols such as “We wish you a Merry Christmas”, “Jingle Bells”, “Rudolph the red-nosed reindeer” and the classic “Silent Night”, is a selection of their own favourites such as “Christmas time in Ireland” and “Silver Bells.” Hosted by Canadian Boyd Kozak, viewers are transported into a winter wonderland.
